docs.lead_paragraph: Hospitals are spending heavily to develop “precision medicine” treatments for cancer based on the special, even unique characteristics of the patient’s genes.

headline.seo: Patients’ Genes Seen as Future of Cancer Care
headline.main: Cancer Centers Racing to Map Patients’ Genes
headline.print_headline: Cancer Centers Racing to Map Patients’ Genes

docs.abstract: Hospitals are spending heavily to customize medical treatments for cancer patients based on special, even unique characteristics of the patient's genes; hope is that combination of genomic analysis with a patient's environmental exposure, family history and other factors will help develop preventative medicine.
docs.snippet: Hospitals are spending heavily to develop “precision medicine” treatments for cancer based on the special, even unique characteristics of the patient’s genes.

docs.lead_paragraph: An analysis by the Bloomberg administration says that almost half of New York City’s population was poor or near-poor in 2011, raising concerns about any cutbacks in federal relief programs.

headline.seo: City Report Shows a Growing Number Are Near Poverty
headline.main: City Report Shows More Were Near Poverty in 2011
headline.print_headline: City Report Shows More Were Near Poverty in 2011

docs.abstract: Bloomberg administration analysis shows that rise in New York City’s poverty rate as a result of the recession has apparently eased, but not before pushing nearly half of the city’s population into the ranks of the poor or near-poor in 2011.
docs.snippet: An analysis by the Bloomberg administration says that almost half of New York City’s population was poor or near-poor in 2011, raising concerns about any cutbacks in federal relief programs.
